Title: Improving SMEs knowledge and performance with cloud computing CSF approach: Systematic literature review
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, I.K., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Inayatulloh, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information technology in particular the internet has changed the company's business processes to improve their performance. The availability of the internet opens up opportunities for companies to get relatively inexpensive resources without space and time limits, one of which is the use of cloud computing to support the company's business processes. Various types of companies have used cloud computing to run their businesses, one of which is SMEs. This paper aims to find out the success factors for using cloud computing for SMEs. A systematic literature review was conducted on 45 journal articles to get the results. The inspected journal paper were available from 2008 to 2018 and displayed 14 success aspects for cloud computing for SMEs. The main factor is organizational support to implementation cloud computing. This research only talks about the use of service cloud computing in Small Medium Enterprise. It is expected that future research will discuss other issues related to the application of cloud computing in Small Medium Enterprises. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Business Process; Journal articles; Organizational support; Service clouds; Small medium enterprise; Space and time; Success factors; Systematic literature review; Cloud computing

Title: The influence of UTAUT model factors on the intension of millennials generation in using mobile wallets in Jakarta
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maryani, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Utaminingsih, K.T., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study was carried out to identify factors affecting the acceptance of mobile wallets by Millennials in Jakarta based on UTAUT (Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology) model. The respondents of this study were mobile wallet users within age ranging from 20-35 years old and living in Jakarta. Payment using cash is still the preferred mode of payment in Indonesia, 92% still choose to use cash as a payment option. Population aged 20 - 35 years, which in Jakarta alone amounted to 40% of the total population of Jakarta. The data was collected using questionnaires directly and also by using Google Form. The respondents in this study amounted to 407, which was using a random sampling technique. The analysis of this study was conducted using Modeling of structural equations-Partial Least Square (SEM-PLS). The result of this study shows that Millennials' Behavioral Intention to use mobile wallet in Jakarta was affected by Effort Expectancy, Age, Facilitating Condition, and Performance Expectancy. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Behavioral intention; Millennials; Mobile wallet; UTAUT
Index Keywords: Information management; Surveys; Behavioral intention; Facilitating conditions; Millennials; Partial least square (PLS); Random sampling; Structural equations; Unified theory of acceptance and use of technology; Utaut models; Electronic money

Authors: Gunawan W., Kristian, Karsen M., Alianto H.
Title: Applying effective knowledge management maturity model
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gunawan, W., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kristian, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Karsen, M., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: In today's world, knowledge has become valuable assets in any organization. Therefore, the use of knowledge should be managed and developed properly to produce maximum benefits, and to support the organisation's objectives. Although knowledge is considered important, many organisations in Indonesia still face many difficulties to measure and implement effective knowledge management (KM). Many corporations have reported major failures in adopting KM system. There is very few reference can be found especially for Indonesian corporations, to apply an effective KM that provides maximum benefits. The article examines the application of knowledge management system (KMS) in XYZ Co., a large IT service company, that serves major large corporations in Indonesia with the purpose to provide a reference of KMS application. The article adopts the successful KMS implementation based on the maturity level that was developed by Uday Kulkarni, Robert St. Louis, and Intel Corp. KMS maturity level has advantages in providing systematic thinking that commonly ignored by the Indonesian corporations. The KMS maturity model has been widely applied in major corporations and produced significant results. The article combines both KMS maturity model and 10-step KM roadmap developed by Armit Tiwana to maximize the output of KMS. The outcome of article is expected to be used as a reference for large corporation in Indonesia to apply KMS. © 2005 – ongoing JATIT & LLS
Author Keywords: KM Maturity Model; Knowledge Management; Knowledge Management Maturity Level; Knowledge Management System

Title: Decision Support System for Badan Ekonomi Kreatif Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hartono, I.K., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Badan Ekonomi Kreatif Indonesia or Bekraf is an institution formed by the government to support the creative industry which consists of 16 fields: architecture; interior design; visual communication design; product design; movies, animations and videos; photography; craft; culinary; music; fashion, application and game developer; publishing; advertising; television and radio; performing Arts; and fine arts. In its implementation, this agency provides assistance to communities throughout Indonesia to develop their creative efforts. The Indonesian government provides full support for the creative industry. The government provides assistance to the creative industry for facilitation of revitalizing physical infrastructure or funding and other guidance and assistance. To get this assistance the community must submit a proposal that will be assessed for its feasibility The proposal received will be assessed for its feasibility by considering several predetermined criteria Therefore, we create a system that can help management make the decision to provide assistance to those who need assistance. The result is a decision making model that helps management to deliver its assistance. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Animation; Architectural design; Artificial intelligence; Decision support systems; Information management; Product design; Visual communication; Creative industries; Decision making models; Fine arts; Indonesia; Interior designs; Performing arts; Visual communication designs; Decision making

Title: Prototype Development for Online Reservation System in Barbershop and Salon Industry
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maryani, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nindito, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this research is to analyze and design an online Barbershop and Salon reservation system that suits the needs of its users, Owners and Customers. On the other hand this system can reduce waiting time for each barbershop and salon. The methodology used to analyze system requirements is to compile a list of questions and disseminate with online Google docs and analyze using partial correlation. The data obtained is then processed to get an overview of the need for this system to be developed. As a result of this research, the Online Reservation System is suitable for use to reduce customer waiting time. Based on our research, it can be concluded that the majority of respondents who go to a salon or Barbershop are young people aged between 21 and 30 years (52%) or aged between 17 and 20 years (43%) with the student profession (85%). We designed a system of online reservation systems on barbershop and salon based on the Web. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Google docs; Online reservation; Partial correlation; Prototype development; System requirements; Waiting-time; Young peoples; Reservation systems

Authors: Danny J., Shanlunt, Wang G., Alianto H.
Title: The Application of Zachman Framework in Improving Better Decision Making
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Danny, J., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Shanlunt, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: System development refers to the use of Information Technology as the foundation for an organization to improve its efficiency and effectivity. The use of Information Technology is hoped to increase its ability in competing with others. The purpose of this research is to use Zachman Framework in enterprise architecture to equalize excellent management vision with system developer so that development of targeted system according to goal. Interviews, observation, and field studies are combined with the literature and knowledge to do this research. The result of this research of Zachman Framework is an enterprise architecture using cloud reporting tools (BI) that helps excellent management in making decisions in order to make business strategies. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Mercia, Gunawan W., Fajar A.N., Alianto H., Inayatulloh
Title: Developing cloud-based Business Process Management (BPM): A survey
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Mercia, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gunawan, W., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fajar, A.N., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Inayatulloh, Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In today's highly competitive business environment, modern enterprises are dealing difficulties to cut unnecessary costs, eliminate wastes and delivery huge benefits for the organization. Companies are increasingly turning to a more flexible IT environment to help them realize this goal. For this reason, the article applies cloud based Business Process Management (BPM) that enables to focus on modeling, monitoring and process management. Cloud based BPM consists of business processes, business information and IT resources, which help build real-time intelligence systems, based on business management and cloud technology. Cloud computing is a paradigm that involves procuring dynamically measurable resources over the internet as an IT resource service. Cloud based BPM service enables to address common problems faced by traditional BPM, especially in promoting flexibility, event-driven business process to exploit opportunities in the marketplace. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.

Title: The smartphone for disseminating of fake news by the university students game player
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Audit Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Surjandy, Information Systems Audit Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chandra, Y.U., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The enhancement of smartphone combine with an internet connection service makes university students can do more easily for social interaction and play online game. A million of games can easily access by using the smartphones for free or pay. However, games have negative side impacts to behave of university students. Somehow, the interaction and disseminating message during play game can be performed intensively. The misbehave of game player and chatting facility for disseminating message, may cause the game player disseminating of fake news as well. Somehow, disseminating of fake news cause serious impacts to the business and safety of human being. Thus, the purpose of this research is to show usage of smartphone for the dissemination of fake news by university students game player and awareness of receiving fake news by the university student game player. The 25 questioners directly distributed to university students randomly and statistical descriptive explanatory analysis use to show university students activities, however the research found new finding result in term of gender and academic rank game player of college student with dissemination and awareness of fake news. The result can be used for higher education industry in regard to minimize circulation of fake news by the students. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Awareness; Dissemination; Fake news; Game player; Social Media

Title: Applying Knowledge Continuity Management in non-profit organization (NPO)
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hendra, Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to present a framework of practical steps for an organization in implementing knowledge continuity management (KCM). This KCM is used to manage the transfer of knowledge from the former staff to successor staff so as to prevent the loss of knowledge when staff left the organization. Methods or steps of this implementation were written based on a case study of KCM implementation in non-profit organization (NPO). The KCM development was carried out through several important stages of process which is based on the concept of KM building blocks, SECI knowledge conversion process, and KCM mapping areas to determine categories of knowledge for all functions and levels of the organization. As the results, there are four important outcomes from this project. First is the determination of knowledge goal; second is the development process of how NPO identify and acquire knowledge; third is applying of four knowledge categories with its subcategories; fourth is the determination of NPO key positions for KCM. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: knowledge continuity management; knowledge transfer; non-profit organization; SECI
Index Keywords: Information management; Profitability; Societies and institutions; Development process; Km building blocks; Knowledge conversion; Knowledge transfer; Mapping area; Non profit organizations; SECI; Transfer of knowledge; Knowledge management
